1.brief: to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)
to broaden (intransitive or transitive, literal or figurative)
properly, to bend or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to favor, bestow; causatively to implore (i.e. move to favor by petition)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn

2.brief: a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
emptiness; figuratively, a worthless thing; adverbially, in vain
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after

3.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to

4.brief: to quiver (with any violent emotion, especially anger or fear)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn
the heart (as the most interior organ);
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a bed (figuratively, a bier); abstractly, sleep; by euphemism, carnal intercourse
to be dumb; by implication, to be astonished, to stop; also to perish

5.brief: to slaughter an animal (usually in sacrifice)
properly, a slaughter, i.e. the flesh of an animal; by implication, a sacrifice (the victim or the act)
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
near, with or among; often in general, to
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

6.brief: abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

7.brief: to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.
must or fresh grape-juice (as just squeezed out); by implication (rarely) fermented wine
properly, to cast together , i.e. increase, especially in number; to multiply by the myriad

8.brief: safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace
to lie down (for rest, sexual connection, decease or any other purpose)
properly, to be slack or languid, i.e. (by implication) sleep (figuratively, to die); also to grow old, stale or inveterate
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, a place of refuge; abstract, safety, both the fact (security) and the feeling (trust); often (adverb with or without preposition) safely
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry

9.brief: safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace
to lie down (for rest, sexual connection, decease or any other purpose)
properly, to be slack or languid, i.e. (by implication) sleep (figuratively, to die); also to grow old, stale or inveterate
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, a place of refuge; abstract, safety, both the fact (security) and the feeling (trust); often (adverb with or without preposition) safely
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
